intro: Ornithogalum sanandajense, commonly known as Sanandaj star-of-Bethlehem, is a rare flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
